full_summary:
### Drinking Water Quality Data Management System

**Procurement Reference Number**: PW-23-01025818
**Tender Closing Date**: 2023-03-09T14:00:00

The proposal aims to obtain a secure, bilingual, and cloud-based drinking water data management system to support the Canada Border Services Agency (CBSA) in managing facility information and water quality data for potable water systems in CBSA-owned facilities.

### Background
The CBSA currently contracts services utilizing a secure and bilingual Internet-based, central data management system to enter and maintain facility information and water quality data for each of its sites. The existing system enables employees to manage alert notifications to ensure that any non-compliance with Health Canada's Guidelines for Canadian Drinking Water Quality (GCDWQ) or provincial/territorial guidelines can be addressed in a timely manner to minimize risks to employee/visitor health.

### Selection Criteria
Bidders must demonstrate that their proposed solution meets the requirements outlined in the solicitation document, including:

*   Certificate of GISN: E103A (Canada)
*   Ability to manage and maintain facility information and water quality data for each site
*   Bilingual (English and French) support for employees
*   Compliance with Health Canada's GCDWQ and provincial/territorial guidelines

### Trade Agreements
The requirement is subject to the provisions of the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and all international free trade agreements, including the World Trade Organization-Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-GPA).

### Solicitation Documents and Debriefings
All relevant material/documentation will be posted on CanadaBuys at the same time as this notice. Bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process. Bidders should make the request to the Contracting Authority within fifteen (15) working days from receipt of the results of the bid solicitation process.

### Tender Description
The proposed system must be able to:

*   Manage and maintain facility information and water quality data for each site
*   Provide alert notifications to ensure that any non-compliance with GCDWQ or provincial/territorial guidelines can be addressed in a timely manner
*   Meet the language requirements of bilingual (English and French) support for employees

The proposed solution must also demonstrate compatibility with existing CBSA systems and provide adequate security measures to protect sensitive data.
